intro: Barleria hereroensis var. charlesii, commonly known as the Herero barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular, two-lipped flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom during the warmer months. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to semi-arid environments. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and flowering display.
